content.detail:
For the first instance of the "Bring Home the Bounty" campaign on StarWars.com, I was part of the web development of frontend features that provided users a newer experience on the site that was unique to this campaign.

During the campaign, each week revealed information on new Star Wars products related to the more recent Star Wars series on Disney+. To build anticipation for site guests, they would be informed on how many weeks were left in the campaign and when new product reveals would drop.

To support this project, I updated an existing frontend feature so that is was more flexible to use for either its traditional purpose or for its new campaign-focused purpose. This was a feature that already allowed site producers to add content grids to pages, whether they linked out to movie pages, databank pages, or more.

I updated this feature so that the particular links within the content grids could do the following:

  • Optionally link out to a page about a specific week's products, unless that week was in the future
  • Provide a message in relation to the specific week, such as if the week's collection was avaialble today or on a specific date in the future
  • Customize the image asset associated with the particular week
  • Indicate which collection number (which week number) was associated with the week
  • Indicate if the collection was currently active (green), pending (red), or coming soon (gray)
